```{r}
df <- read.table(text = data, sep = " ")
df$type <- substr(df$V1, 1, 3)
```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(df, aes(x = V2)) +
    geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.1) +
    facet_wrap(vars(type))

ggplot(df, aes(x = V2, group = type, fill = type)) +
    geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.1, position = "dodge") +
    scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, NA)) +
    theme_bw() +
    labs(x = "Siderophore production")
```

```{r}
plt <- ggplot(df, aes(x = V2 -1, group = type)) +
    geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05, color = "black", fill = "#FFFFFF") +
    facet_wrap(vars(type), ncol = 1,scales = "free_y") +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(aspect.ratio = 0.5) +
    scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, NA)) +
    labs(x = "Siderophore production")

plt
ggsave("searle.svg", plot = plt, width = 4, height = 4)
```

# Butaite 2017
Table S1
```{r}
butaite <- read.table("butaite.tsv", sep = "\t", header = T)
```

```{r}
plt <- ggplot(butaite, aes(x = PVDrel_transferrin, group = habitat_type)) +
    geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05, color = "black", fill = "#999999") +
    facet_wrap(vars(habitat_type), ncol = 1, scales = "free_y") +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(aspect.ratio = 0.5) +
    labs(x = "Siderophore production")

plt
ggsave("butaite.svg", plot = plt, width = 4, height = 4)
```
